title: Fix trolling in ranked, link to real life ID.
body:
Hey Riot,

The anonymity of the internet seems to be linked to incentivizing trolling/ragers. Why not introduce a separate ranked queue for people that will confirm there real life identity privately to you (facebook, cell phone).  Have acceptance  based on the honor system so low honor people are not allowed on.  Then allow people to build honour in normals to escape the prisoners island of a created anonymous ranked.

People will also be wary of typing things that can come back and get them later in life.

Thanks

replies.body:
It would be dead on arrival (nobody wants to go through that effort), not to mention spoofing facebook or a cellphone is incredibly easy.

Incidentally LoL accounts already _do_ link to facebook.
Lose lane, get stalked. No thanks.
If it were public, then yeah, but if Riot kept the info to themselves then the idea might have merit.
Granted I would hope a gaming company wouldn't be a high priority target. Too many data breaches from stores and credit bureau's for me to want to bother.

I definitely understand your concern, but I don't think a breach would be likely to affect this, and here's why:

1. Hackers who create breaches do so to profit, so they will be looking for financial data, not social media and email accounts.

2. Riot could also simply store whether or not each account is verified with a boolean rather than storing the account's identifying info.
